result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stone Michael Hudson appeared by phone.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Stone Michael Hudson. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stone Michael Hudson appeared by phone.  Attorney Anna Hartz appeared by video on behalf of Ryan W O'Hara for Stone Michael Hudson. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stone Michael Hudson appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Stone Michael Hudson.Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $1000 Signature Bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim MA, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No intentional contact with Officer Winnie. Absolute Sobriety at all times. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
